DOC.brief_summary: The investigators hypothesize that the chronic kidney disease patients who suffer from vitamin D deficiency will be benefit from given Vitamin D2 because coronary artery calcification and hyperparathyroidism will be improved.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Vitamin D Supplementation on Coronary Calcification and Parathyroid Hormone in CKD Patients
DOC.detailed_description: We will call for 350 CKD patients (250 CKD3-5stage and 100 CKD5D stage)who suffer from vitamin D deficiency.They will be divided into 2 groups. One group will be given vitamin D and the other will not. They will take coronary artery CT test every year(in 2 years).We will compare the coronary calcification progression between the 2 groups.
DOC.criteria: chronic kidney disease patients (35D) serum 25（OH）D < 40nmol/L(16ng/ml)，serum calcium < 2.55mmol/L（10.2mg/dL）； willing to sign could obey the follow up design allergy to vitamin D heart failure (NYHA more than 2 grade) pregnant malignant tumor critical hepatic disease taking Vitamin D or analogue in 3 recent months taking other clinical trial
DOC.keyword: The calcification score of coronary artery
